title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

title: Aggregate across time — aggregate
text: data data frame .var variable aggregate along .scale time scale aggregate ... ignore na.rm logical, whether remove pending NAs aggregated .new_name output name

title: Aggregate across time — aggregate
text: data frame variable specified aggregated scale

title: Aggregate across time — aggregate
code: # first 11 NA rows are removed unless specified through na.rm = FALSE tenterfield %>%   init(id = id, time = ym, indicators = prcp:tavg) %>%   aggregate(.var = prcp, .scale = 12) #> Warning: Unquoting language objects with `!!!` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0. #> Please use `!!` instead. #>  #>   # Bad: #>   dplyr::select(data, !!!enquo(x)) #>  #>   # Good: #>   dplyr::select(data, !!enquo(x))    # Unquote single quosure #>   dplyr::select(data, !!!enquos(x))  # Splice list of quosures #>  #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Index pipeline:  #>  #> Summary:  #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~prcp, sum, .before = 12 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> .agg #>  #> Data:  #> # A tibble: 358 × 8 #>    id                ym  prcp  tmax   tmin  tavg  .agg .scale #>    <chr>          <mth> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 ASN00056032 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6   8382     12 #>  2 ASN00056032 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7   8608     12 #>  3 ASN00056032 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8   7976     12 #>  4 ASN00056032 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0   7926     12 #>  5 ASN00056032 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4   6376     12 #>  6 ASN00056032 1991 May   630  21.3  7.52  14.4   5786     12 #>  7 ASN00056032 1991 Jun   242  19.6  3.65  11.6   5634     12 #>  8 ASN00056032 1991 Jul   580  15.3  0.519  7.91  5596     12 #>  9 ASN00056032 1991 Aug    14  17.8  1.67   9.76  5276     12 #> 10 ASN00056032 1991 Sep    78  21.1  3.07  12.1   5088     12 #> # … with 348 more rows  # with multiple scales tenterfield %>%   init(id = id, time = ym, indicators = prcp:tavg) %>%   aggregate(.var = prcp, .scale = c(12, 24)) #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Index pipeline:  #>  #> Summary:  #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~prcp, sum, .before = 12 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> .agg #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~prcp, sum, .before = 24 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> .agg #>  #> Data:  #> # A tibble: 704 × 8 #>    id                ym  prcp  tmax   tmin  tavg .scale  .agg #>    <chr>          <mth> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 ASN00056032 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6      12  8382 #>  2 ASN00056032 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7      12  8608 #>  3 ASN00056032 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8      12  7976 #>  4 ASN00056032 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0      12  7926 #>  5 ASN00056032 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4      12  6376 #>  6 ASN00056032 1991 May   630  21.3  7.52  14.4      12  5786 #>  7 ASN00056032 1991 Jun   242  19.6  3.65  11.6      12  5634 #>  8 ASN00056032 1991 Jul   580  15.3  0.519  7.91     12  5596 #>  9 ASN00056032 1991 Aug    14  17.8  1.67   9.76     12  5276 #> 10 ASN00056032 1991 Sep    78  21.1  3.07  12.1      12  5088 #> # … with 694 more rows

title: Title — compute_indexes
code: library(lmomco) library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘lubridate’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union library(SPEI) #> # Package SPEI (1.8.0) loaded [try SPEINews()]. res <- tenterfield %>% init(id = id, time = ym) %>%   compute_indexes(     spi = idx_spi(.dist = loglogistic()),     spei = idx_spei(),     edi = idx_edi()   ) #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> [1] "Checking for missing values (`NA`): all the data must be complete. Input type is vector. Assuming the data are monthly time series starting in January, all regular (non-leap) years." #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation

title: Dimension reduction — dim_red
text: data data ... expression evaluate new_name new name

title: Title — dist_fit
text: .data data frame .dist distributions .gran granularity .var variable .n_boot number bootstrap samples, default 1 .boot_seed seed bootstrap sampling .method fitting methods, one lmoms (L-moment), mle (Maximum Likelihood), mom (Method moment) .gamma_adjust adjustment gamma, add reference

title: Pre-built indexes — idx_spei
code: idx_spei(   data,   id,   time,   .pet_method = "thornthwaite",   .scale = 12,   .dist = loglogistic(),   .new_name = ".index" )  idx_spi(data, id, time, .dist = gamma(), .scale = 12, .new_name = ".index")  idx_rdi(   data,   id,   time,   .pet_method = "thornthwaite",   .scale = .scale,   .new_name = ".index" )  idx_edi(data, id, time, .scale = 12, .new_name = ".index")

title: Pre-built indexes — idx_spei
text: data data id id time time .pet_method PET method .scale scale .dist distribution .new_name new names

title: Pre-built indexes — idx_spei
code: library(lmomco) library(lubridate) library(SPEI) tenterfield %>% init(id = id, time = ym) %>% idx_spei(.dist = list(gev(), loglogistic())) #> [1] "Checking for missing values (`NA`): all the data must be complete. Input type is vector. Assuming the data are monthly time series starting in January, all regular (non-leap) years." #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Index pipeline:  #>  #> Summary:  #> var_trans: `.pet_method(Tave = ~tavg, lat = ~-29.0479)` -> pet #> dim_red: `prcp - pet` -> diff #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~diff, sum, .before = 12 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> .agg #> dist fit: `NA` -> .fit #> dist fit: `NA` -> .fit #> normalise: `NA` -> .fitted #> normalise: `qnorm(.fitted)` -> .index #>  #> Data:  #> # A tibble: 716 × 15 #>    .period id                ym  prcp  tmax  tmin  tavg   pet  diff  .agg .scale #>      <dbl> <chr>          <mth> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1      12 ASN00056032 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6 127.  513.  7587.     12 #>  2      12 ASN00056032 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6 127.  513.  7587.     12 #>  3       1 ASN00056032 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7 118.  990.  7808.     12 #>  4       1 ASN00056032 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7 118.  990.  7808.     12 #>  5       2 ASN00056032 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8 102.  526.  7171.     12 #>  6       2 ASN00056032 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8 102.  526.  7171.     12 #>  7       3 ASN00056032 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0  86.7 117.  7118.     12 #>  8       3 ASN00056032 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0  86.7 117.  7118.     12 #>  9       4 ASN00056032 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4  56.6 -12.6 5574.     12 #> 10       4 ASN00056032 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4  56.6 -12.6 5574.     12 #> # … with 706 more rows, and 4 more variables: .method <chr>, .fitted <dbl>, #> #   .dist <chr>, .index <dbl> tenterfield %>% init(id = id, time = ym) %>% idx_spi() #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Index pipeline:  #>  #> Summary:  #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~prcp, sum, .before = 12 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> .agg #> dist fit: `NA` -> .fit #> normalise: `NA` -> .fitted #> normalise: `qnorm(.fitted)` -> .index #>  #> Data:  #> # A tibble: 358 × 13 #>    .period id           ym  prcp  tmax   tmin  tavg  .agg .scale .method .fitted #>      <dbl> <chr>     <mth> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> #>  1      12 ASN00… 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6   8382     12 lmoms    0.700  #>  2       1 ASN00… 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7   8608     12 lmoms    0.724  #>  3       2 ASN00… 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8   7976     12 lmoms    0.608  #>  4       3 ASN00… 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0   7926     12 lmoms    0.595  #>  5       4 ASN00… 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4   6376     12 lmoms    0.258  #>  6       5 ASN00… 1991 May   630  21.3  7.52  14.4   5786     12 lmoms    0.178  #>  7       6 ASN00… 1991 Jun   242  19.6  3.65  11.6   5634     12 lmoms    0.152  #>  8       7 ASN00… 1991 Jul   580  15.3  0.519  7.91  5596     12 lmoms    0.139  #>  9       8 ASN00… 1991 Aug    14  17.8  1.67   9.76  5276     12 lmoms    0.0967 #> 10       9 ASN00… 1991 Sep    78  21.1  3.07  12.1   5088     12 lmoms    0.0837 #> # … with 348 more rows, and 2 more variables: .dist <chr>, .index <dbl> tenterfield %>% init(id = id, time = ym) %>% idx_edi() #> Removing the pending NAs due to aggregation #> Index pipeline:  #>  #> Summary:  #> var_trans: `rev(digamma(dplyr::row_number() + 1) - digamma(1))` -> w #> var_trans: `prcp * w` -> mult #> temporal: `slider::slide_dbl(~mult, sum, .before = 12 - 1, .complete = TRUE)` #> -> ep #> var_trans: `rescale_zscore(var = ~ep)` -> .index #>  #> Data:  #> # A tibble: 358 × 11 #>    id             ym  prcp  tmax   tmin  tavg     w   mult     ep .scale  .index #>    <chr>       <mth> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 ASN0005… 1990 Dec   640  30.4 14.7   22.6   6.46 4134.  54292.     12  0.909  #>  2 ASN0005… 1991 Jan  1108  27.5 15.9   21.7   6.46 7154.  55722.     12  1.02   #>  3 ASN0005… 1991 Feb   628  28.0 15.5   21.8   6.45 4053.  51601.     12  0.703  #>  4 ASN0005… 1991 Mar   204  26.2 11.8   19.0   6.45 1316.  51270.     12  0.677  #>  5 ASN0005… 1991 Apr    44  24.2  6.57  15.4   6.45  284.  41223.     12 -0.0913 #>  6 ASN0005… 1991 May   630  21.3  7.52  14.4   6.45 4060.  37380.     12 -0.385  #>  7 ASN0005… 1991 Jun   242  19.6  3.65  11.6   6.44 1559.  36387.     12 -0.461  #>  8 ASN0005… 1991 Jul   580  15.3  0.519  7.91  6.44 3735.  36122.     12 -0.482  #>  9 ASN0005… 1991 Aug    14  17.8  1.67   9.76  6.44   90.1 34051.     12 -0.640  #> 10 ASN0005… 1991 Sep    78  21.1  3.07  12.1   6.43  502.  32832.     12 -0.733  #> # … with 348 more rows

what: indri: What the Package Does (Title Case) — indri-package
title: indri: What the Package Does (Title Case) — indri-package
text: (maybe one line) Use four spaces indenting paragraphs within Description.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Rescaling functions — normal
code: normal()  weibull()  loglogistic()  gev()  pearsonIII()  rescale_zscore(var, na.rm = TRUE)  rescale_minmax(var, min = NULL, max = NULL, na.rm = TRUE, censor = TRUE)  rescale_center(var, na.rm = TRUE)

title: Rescaling functions — normal
text: var variable na.rm logical; whether remove NAs min min max max censor logical; whether censor points outside min max, provided

title: Title — swap_exprs
text: obj indri object .var variable try alternative expression .exprs new expressions test .raw_data initial indri object created

title: Title — swap_values
text: obj obj .module module .step step .res res .var var .values values .raw_data original data

what: Precipitation in the Tenterfield station from 1990 to 2020 — tenterfield
title: Precipitation in the Tenterfield station from 1990 to 2020 — tenterfield
Precipitation in the Tenterfield station from 1990 to 2020 — tenterfield
Precipitation in the Tenterfield station from 1990 to 2020 — tenterfield
text: tibble three columns: id station ID, corresponds tenterfied station ym date yearmonth prcp summed monthly precipitation daily data

title: Title — theme_benchmark
code: if (require("ggplot2", quietly = TRUE) ){ dplyr::tibble(x = 1:100, y = rnorm(100, sd = 2)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = x, y =y )) +   geom_line() +   theme_benchmark() }

title: Variable transformation — var_trans
text: data data ... expression .method method use .vars variables .new_name new name
